titleStmt.title: The merry conceited humors of Bottom the weaver. As it hath been often publikely acted by some of his majesties comedians, and lately, privately, presented, by several apprentices for their harmless recreation, with great applause.
titleStmt.author: Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616. Midsummer night's dream. Selections

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed, for F. Kirkman and H. Marsh, at the Io. Fletchert Head, on the backside of St. Clements, and the Princes Arms in Chancery Lane nere Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: From A Midsummer night's dream. Cf. Nicoll, p. 418.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
